docs.text: this sunday afternoon i had the priviledge of attending a private screening at the sony astor cinema in new york city , of james cameron's most heralded film , titanic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: postponed from last summer , with an escalated budget that makes it the most expensive movie in history , this was one film i was eager to preview .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so , is this movie going to sink or swim this holiday ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my best guess . . . . it will sink , though with many awards attatched to its hull .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no doubt , titanic is the most elaborate disaster movie ever made .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it boasts the most amazing effects that i have ever seen done to date .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to see a ship fall apart , with actual people running across the ship , flying across the deck , and falling to the water , is just amazing to look at .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the effects are so stunningly realistic , you would swear you were looking at actual footage .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but titanic is more than a disaster movie , and that's where the problem lies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is a love story attatched that nearly ruins the entire premise .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'll give a capsule summary of the story without spoiling anything for you :
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film begins with a modern day excavation of sorts of the sunken titanic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we see actual footage of the sunken ship , as cammeron had set up special cameras to film the wreckage on the ocean floor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bill paxton leads the expedition , in search of sunken treasure .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what he finds instead , leads him to a mysterious old woman who recounts her tale of the titanic voyage .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we meet rose ( kate winslet ) , a young woman , who comes from an upper-class family .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rose is to be wed to a man she does not love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we meet jack ( leonardo dicaprio ) , a young man , who comes from a poor financial background , and wins a ticket aboard the titanic , in a poker game .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the two meet under interesting circumstances , and the love story begins .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: add in a jealous fiance , and a not-so-nice law officer played by david warner , and you have a story that , well , gets a bit overplayed and oversappy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i must add , at this point , that the most likeable character in the movie is played by kathy bates , as a woman with " new money " who is a lot less uptight than the other rich folk on the ship .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is a pleasure to see on screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the ship does hit the iceberg at exactly 1 : 40 into the film , and eventually sinks , you never really feel for any of these characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is just loaded with unlikeable rich snobs and other folk you never really get a grasp on .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the effects are tremendous .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the roars of gears and pumps in the engine room , to a doomed ship cracking at the seams , this is an effects picture that looks and sounds like no other .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we saw titanic in dolby digital surround , and by far , it is the best sounding movie i have ever seen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my friend commented it was the best sound mix he has ever heard .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when people are in the water , at film's end , you are surrounded by the voices of lost soles .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: titanic runs far too long .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the movie is 3 hours and 15 minutes in length .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and , while most of the first 2 . 5 hours runs very fast and well-paced , the final 45 minutes almost comes to a sudden stop , and you realize that this sappy love story has to finish itself out before the movie finally ends .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: don't get me wrong about titanic . . . . it's
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not a bad as i am making it out to be .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it really is an exceptionaly well-made film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the costumes and sets are incredible , and true to the time period .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the ship is painstakingly created exactly true to form , as we see actual pictures of the modern-day wreckage , transformed into the movie depiction .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this film will certainly win on effects , costume , set design and sound .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cameron has certainly made his best film to date .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , titanic is not a best picture candidate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it just doesn't have a strong supporting story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's an exceptional disaster film with sappy filler inside .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it just doesn't have the emotional impact that i suspect mr . cameron was shooting for .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i predict that titanic will open to likeable reviews .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is a film worth seeing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i predict that it will only do moderately well at the box office .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with its extreme running time , and lack of enough robust to get substantial word-of-mouth , i expect that it will do even better on home video .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this will certainly be the definitive ac3 movie for all you home theater enthusiasts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: titanic opens december 19th , and is released by paramount pictures and twentieth century-fox .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i give titanic 3 stars ( .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's not bad .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ron epstein
docs.label: positive
